content:
Announcing SUSHI 0.6.0 w/

  • Support for ValueSets
  • Support for CodeSystems
  • Improved support for Instances
  • Improved support for profiles/extensions
  • Various bug fixes

See the release notes for details: https://github.com/FHIR/sushi/releases/tag/v0.6.0
There was a discussion to support multiple input folders to organize the artifacts - is this on the roadmap?
Of course, I could just have separate folders and run sushi in each one - :)
I think it makes sense to have separated folders. Possibly in the same structure as the output folders?
We're going to do that but it hasn't been implemented yet, sorry.
Is the ability to set the .text element on the roadmap?
One thing I consider important is the ability to use profiles that are not in the fsh tank.
